The incidents appear to be impacting various online services and platforms, with Downdetector reporting tens of thousands of reports.

item.title: OpenPGP.js Vulnerability Allows Attackers to Bypass Message Signature Verification
item.description: Vulnerable Product: OpenPGP.js; CVE(s): CVE-2025-47934; Summary: A critical vulnerability in OpenPGP.js (versions 5.0.1 to 5.11.2 and 6.0.0-alpha.0 to 6.1.0) allows attackers to spoof message signatures, potentially undermining the trust model of public key cryptography. The flaw enables attackers to manipulate signed or signed-and-encrypted messages so that they appear to be validly signed by a trusted party even when the underlying data has been maliciously altered.

item.title: Windows Defender Bypass Using PowerShell and Registry Edits in CyberEYE RAT
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N/A; CVE(s): None; Summary: CyberEye is a remote access trojan (RAT) that uses Telegram as its command-and-control (C2) infrastructure. It has sophisticated capabilities, including keyloggers, file grabbers, clipboard hijackers, and persistence mechanisms, making it easy for attackers to customize payloads and evade detection.

item.title: Know thyself, know thy environment
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various software (catdoc, Parallel, NVIDIA, High-Logic FontCreator); CVE(s): None; Summary: Several vulnerabilities were disclosed across various software products, including catdoc which posed an exception as the vendor was unreachable. These vulnerabilities highlight risks in widely used software, potentially exposing systems to attacks such as privilege escalation, memory corruption, and data leaks.

item.title: WordPress Sites Turned Weapon: How VexTrio and Affiliates Run a Global Scam Network
item.description: VexTrio ViperTraffic Distribution Service (TDS) is a sophisticated cybercriminal operation distributing malicious content through smartlinks and push notifications. The operation involves multiple TDS services, including Help TDS and Disposable TDS, which redirect victims to scam infrastructure. VexTrio's malware actors are often linked to Russian-connected infrastructure, and the company's operations have been compromised by DNS threat intelligence firm Qurium.

item.title: Graphite spyware used in Apple iOS zero-click attacks on journalists
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Paragon's Graphite spyware platform; CVE(s): CVE-2025-43200; Summary: The Graphite spyware platform was used to launch zero-click attacks against at least two journalists' Apple iOS devices. The attack exploited a zero-day vulnerability in the processing of maliciously crafted photos or videos shared via an iCloud Link, allowing remote code execution without any interaction from the target.

item.title: AitM Phishing Attacks on Microsoft 365 and Google Aimed at Stealing Login Credentials
item.description: A dramatic escalation in phishing attacks leveraging Adversary-in-the-Middle (AiTM) techniques has swept across organizations worldwide. These attacks use sophisticated reverse proxy servers to intercept user credentials and session cookies in real-time, bypassing even advanced security measures like Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA). Threat actors are constantly refining their methods to evade detection, employing various tactics such as HTML and SVG attachments, QR codes, and encrypted scripts.

item.title: OneLogin AD Connector Vulnerabilities Expose Authentication Credentials
item.description: Vulnerable Product: OneLogin Active Directory (AD)Connector; CVE(s): None; Summary: A critical security vulnerability in OneLogin's AD Connector service allowed malicious actors to obtain authentication credentials, impersonate users, and access sensitive applications. The flaw was exploited by obtaining AWS credentials hard-coded in logs and using them to forge valid JSON Web Tokens (JWTs), enabling unauthorized access to enterprise applications.

item.title: Threat Actors Using Bat Files to Deploy Quasar RAT
item.description: The article discusses a Quasar Remote Access Trojan (RAT) campaign that uses strong obfuscation and anti-sandbox techniques to evade detection. The malware infection begins with a batch script attached to a seemingly harmless document, which downloads an obfuscated second-stage file from a remote server. The malware then checks for virtual drives commonly used by sandboxes and kills itself if detected, making automated analysis difficult.

item.title: Password-spraying attacks target 80,000 Microsoft Entra ID accounts
item.description: The TeamFiltration pentesting framework has been used by threat actor UNK_SneakyStrike to target over 80,000 Microsoft Entra ID accounts at hundreds of organizations worldwide. The campaign used AWS servers across multiple regions and exploited vulnerabilities in Office 365 API for account enumeration.

item.title: 137,000 SoftBank Customers Affected by Data Leak from Third-Party Vendor
item.description: The article discusses SoftBank's approach to data security, highlighting the importance of comprehensive policies, employee training, and technical safeguards. It also emphasizes the need for robust data protection frameworks to prevent data leaks and breaches, particularly in outsourcing contexts. Additionally, the article touches on regulatory compliance and the evolving nature of cybersecurity threats in the telecommunications industry.

item.title: Multiple GitLab Vulnerabilities Expose Users to Complete Account Takeover Risks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: GitLab; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4278, CVE-2025-2254, CVE-2025-5121, CVE-2025-0673, CVE-2025-1516, CVE-2025-1478, CVE-2024-9512, CVE-2025-5195, CVE-2025-5982; Summary: GitLab has released urgent security updates to address multiple high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to take over user accounts, inject malicious code, and disrupt services. The vulnerabilities include account takeover via injected HTML, cross-site scripting, injecting malicious CI/CD jobs, and denial-of-service attacks.

item.title: New TokenBreak Attack Bypasses AI Moderation with Single-Character Text Changes
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various Large Language Models (LLMs); CVE(s): None; Summary: The TokenBreak attack technique can bypass LLMs' safety and content moderation guardrails by manipulating input text with single character changes. This manipulation causes the tokenizer to split the text differently, allowing malicious input to be classified as legitimate, potentially leading to prompt injection attacks.

item.title: Microsoft Resolves Windows Server 2025 Restart Bug Disrupting Active Directory Connectivity
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows Server 2025; CVE(s): CVE-2025-26647, None; Summary: The vulnerability affects Windows Server 2025 domain controllers, causing authentication failures and network connectivity problems. The issue occurs when security update KB5055523 changes how domain controllers validate certificates used for Kerberos authentication, requiring certificates to chain to an issuing certificate authority (CA) in the NTAuth store. The problem is resolved with the June 2025 Patch Tuesday updates.

item.title: Microsoft Edge now offers secure password deployment for businesses
item.description: Microsoft has announced the general availability of a new feature for Microsoft Edge, allowing administrators to deploy encrypted shared passwords to specific user groups in enterprise environments. This feature aims to minimize the risk of unauthorized access by ensuring that employees do not accidentally share passwords with unintended recipients.

item.title: AI Agents Run on Secret Accounts — Learn How to Secure Them in This Webinar
item.description: This article discusses the growing threat of non-human identities (NHI) created by AI agents, chatbots, and automation scripts. These invisible identities, such as API keys, service accounts, and OAuth tokens, are powerful and unsecured, allowing attackers to move laterally through cloud infrastructure, deploy malware, and exfiltrate data without triggering alerts. The article emphasizes the need for new strategies to secure these NHIs, citing traditional IAM tools as insufficient for this task.

item.title: Privilege Escalation in PAN-OS Web Interface Allows Admin Users to Perform Root Actions
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS operating system; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4231; Summary: A medium-severity command injection vulnerability (CVE-2025-4231) in the management web interface of PAN-OS allows authenticated administrative users to escalate privileges and execute commands as the root user, potentially compromising the entire firewall system.

item.title: GitLab patches high severity account takeover, missing auth issues
item.description: Vulnerable Product: GitLab; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4278, CVE-2025-5121, CVE-2025-2254, CVE-2025-0673; Summary: Multiple vulnerabilities in GitLab's DevSecOps platform allow attackers to take over accounts, inject malicious jobs, and exploit cross-site scripting and denial of service flaws. Successful exploitation requires authenticated access with a GitLab Ultimate license.

item.title: Command Injection Flaw in Palo Alto PAN-OS Allows Root-Level Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4230; Summary: A command injection vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software allows authenticated administrators to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges, enabling file system modifications, unauthorized service disruptions, and lateral network movement. The vulnerability impacts PAN-OS versions 10.x and 11.x, and is exploitable locally without user interaction.

item.title: Dark Web Profile: DragonForce Ransomware
item.description: The article discusses the DragonForce Ransomware group, which has emerged as a significant threat in the cyber landscape. The group is known for its aggressive double extortion tactics, using both custom and borrowed tools to steal data, encrypt systems, and pressure victims into paying ransoms. The article provides an overview of the group's operations, including their use of leaked ransomware builders, advanced evasion techniques, and organized affiliate model. It also highlights the importance of proactive defense and intelligence gathering in detecting and stopping DragonForce attacks before they cause harm.

item.title: CISA Releases Cybersecurity Advisory on SimpleHelp RMM Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SimpleHelp; CVE(s): CVE-2024-57727, None; Summary: Ransomware actors exploited an unpatched path traversal vulnerability (CVE-2024-57727) in SimpleHelp Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM) versions 5.5.7 and earlier to compromise customers of a utility billing software provider, resulting in service disruptions and double extortion incidents.

item.title: Ransomware Actors Exploit Unpatched SimpleHelp Remote Monitoring and Management to Compromise Utility Billing Software Provider
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SimpleHelp Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM); CVE(s): CVE-2024-57727; Summary: Ransomware actors are leveraging unpatched instances of SimpleHelp RMM, specifically versions 5.5.7 and earlier, to compromise customers. The vulnerability, CVE-2024-57727, is a path traversal vulnerability that allows attackers to access downstream customers' networks.

item.title: Siemens SCALANCE and RUGGEDCOM
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens SCALANCE and RUGGEDCOM products; CVE(s): CVE-2024-41797; Summary: The vulnerability is an incorrect authorization check that allows an authenticated remote attacker with "guest" role to invoke an internal "do system" command exceeding their privileges. This could allow the execution of certain low-risk actions, including clearing the local system log.

item.title: AVEVA PI Connector for CygNet
item.description: Vulnerable Product: AVEVA PI Connector for CygNet; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4417, CVE-2025-4418; Summary: Cross-site scripting and improper validation of integrity check value vulnerabilities exist in PI Connector for CygNet Versions 1.6.14 and prior, allowing an attacker to persist arbitrary code or cause a denial-of-service condition.

item.title: Siemens Energy Services
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens G5DFR; CVE(s): CVE-2025-40585; Summary: The vulnerability, due to incorrect default permissions, allows an attacker to gain remote control of the G5DFR component and tamper with outputs from the device. Successful exploitation could result in unauthorized access and manipulation of the device's outputs.

item.title: Siemens SCALANCE and RUGGEDCOM
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens SCALANCE and RUGGEDCOM products; CVE(s): CVE-2025-40567, CVE-2025-40568, CVE-2025-40569; Summary: The "Load Rollback" functionality in the web interface of affected products contains an incorrect authorization check vulnerability. This could allow an authenticated remote attacker with a "guest" role to make the affected product roll back to a previous configuration. Additionally, the "Load Configuration from Local PC" functionality in the web interface of affected products contains a race condition vulnerability that allows an authenticated remote attacker to load an attacker-controlled configuration instead of the legitimate one. The third vulnerability is a race condition that occurs when a legitimate administrator invokes the "Load Configuration from Local PC" functionality and the attacker wins the race. Successful exploitation requires that a legitimate administrator invokes the functionality and the attacker wins the race.

item.title: PTZOptics and Other Pan-Tilt-Zoom Cameras
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PTZOptics PT30X-SDI/NDI-xx before firmware 6.3.40; CVE(s): CVE-2024-8956, CVE-2024-8957; Summary: The camera is vulnerable to insufficient authentication and OS command injection issues, allowing an attacker to leak sensitive data, execute arbitrary commands, and access the admin web interface using hard-coded credentials.

item.title: AVEVA PI Data Archive
item.description: Vulnerable Product: AVEVA PI Data Archive, AVEVA PI Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-44019, CVE-2025-36539; Summary: The products are vulnerable to an uncaught exception that can be exploited by an authenticated user to shut down necessary subsystems and cause a denial-of-service condition.

item.title: Siemens SIMATIC S7-1500 CPU Family
item.description: The provided article appears to be a collection of multiple Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs) from various sources, including Linux kernel, GnuTLS, OpenSSH, and others. Each CVE has its own unique characteristics, such as CVSS score, vector string, and description.

item.title: Siemens RUGGEDCOM APE1808
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens RUGGEDCOM APE1808; CVE(s): CVE-2025-0133; Summary: A reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the GlobalProtect gateway and portal features of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables execution of malicious JavaScript in the context of an authenticated Captive Portal user's browser when they click on a specially crafted link, potentially leading to phishing attacks and credential theft.

item.title: CISA Releases Ten Industrial Control Systems Advisories
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None listed; CVE(s): None; Summary: CISA released 10 ICS advisories on June 12, 2025, providing information about current security issues, vulnerabilities, and exploits surrounding industrial control systems. The advisories cover various products from Siemens and AVEVA, and users are encouraged to review them for technical details and mitigations.

item.title: Siemens Tecnomatix Plant Simulation
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens Tecnomatix Plant Simulation; CVE(s): CVE-2025-32454; Summary: The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process by reading past the end of an allocated structure while parsing specially crafted WRL files. Successful exploitation could lead to remote code execution.

item.title: AVEVA PI Web API
item.description: Vulnerable Product: AVEVA PI Web API; CVE(s): CVE-2025-2745; Summary: A cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in AVEVA PI Web API versions 2023 SP1 and prior, allowing an authenticated attacker to persist arbitrary JavaScript code that can be executed by users who disable content security policy protections. Successful exploitation could allow the attacker to disable content security policy protections, leading to potential attacks.

item.title: Trend Micro Apex One Zero-Day Vulnerability Enables Attackers to Inject Malicious Code
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Trend Micro Apex One; CVE(s): CVE-2025-49154, CVE-2025-49155, CVE-2025-49156, CVE-2025-49157, CVE-2025-49158; Summary: Five critical vulnerabilities in Trend Micro's Apex One endpoint security platform allow attackers to execute arbitrary code and escalate privileges on affected systems. The most severe vulnerability, CVE-2025-49154, allows local attackers to overwrite key memory-mapped files, while the fifth vulnerability, CVE-2025-49155, enables remote attackers to execute arbitrary code with user interaction.

item.title: Zero-Click AI Vulnerability Exposes Microsoft 365 Copilot Data Without User Interaction
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft 365 Copilot; CVE(s): CVE-2025-32711; Summary: The EchoLeak vulnerability is a zero-click AI vulnerability that allows attackers to exfiltrate sensitive data from Microsoft 365 Copilot's context without user interaction. It requires no customer action and has been already addressed by Microsoft.

item.title: Non-Human Identities: How to Address the Expanding Security Risk
item.description: The article highlights the risks and challenges associated with non-human identities (machine identities), such as service accounts, API keys, bots, automation, and workload identities. It emphasizes that traditional secrets managers do not address the full lifecycle of NHI governance, leading to a high risk of secrets leakage.

item.title: Cybercriminals Advertise Advanced MaaS Botnet with Blockchain C2 on Hacking Forums
item.description: The article discusses the alleged sale of a sophisticated Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) botnet that combines legitimate development frameworks with cutting-edge evasion techniques. The botnet leverages Node.js runtime, blockchain-based command and control infrastructure, and modern web technologies to create a highly resilient and scalable malicious platform.

item.title: Windows 11 24H2 emergency update fixes Easy Anti-Cheat BSOD issue
item.description: Microsoft has released an emergency Windows 11 24H2 update (KB5063060) to address an incompatibility issue causing system restarts and blue screens of death (BSOD) errors on systems with Easy Anti-Cheat, a popular anti-cheating service used by hundreds of multiplayer games.

item.title: JSFireTruck: Exploring Malicious JavaScript Using JSF*ck as an Obfuscation Technique
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Various websites; CVE(s): None; Summary: A large-scale campaign has been compromising legitimate websites with injected, obfuscated JavaScript code. The code uses the JSFireTruck technique to hide its true purpose and redirect users to malicious URLs, potentially leading to malware downloads or other harmful activities.
FYSA: This campaign is widespread and has infected many websites, making it a significant threat. Malware authors use this technique to make code analysis more difficult, and website administrators must keep their web servers up-to-date with the latest security updates and analyze their web servers for any signs of infection or compromise.

item.title: Hackers Launch Coordinated Attack on Apache Tomcat Manager from 400 Unique IPs
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache Tomcat; CVE(s): None; Summary: GreyNoise Intelligence has identified a significant coordinated attack campaign targeting Apache Tomcat Manager interfaces across the globe. The campaign involves nearly 400 unique IP addresses conducting large-scale reconnaissance and access attempts, with security experts warning that such broad scanning activities often precede more targeted exploitation attempts.

item.title: Fog ransomware attack uses unusual mix of legitimate and open-source tools
item.description: Fog ransomware operation uses an uncommon toolset, including open-source pentesting utilities and a legitimate employee monitoring software called Syteca. The toolset includes tools like Stowaway, SMBExec, GC2, Adapt2x C2, Process Watchdog, PsExec, Impacket SMB, 7-Zip, MegaSync, and FreeFileSync utilities.

item.title: New Campaign Targets Entra ID User Accounts Using Pentesting Tool for Account Takeover
item.description: A large-scale Account Takeover (ATO) campaign, internally tracked as UNK_SneakyStrike, has been discovered by Proofpoint Threat Intelligence. The campaign targets Microsoft Entra ID user accounts across global organizations, using the open-source penetration testing framework TeamFiltration to target over 80,000 user accounts and compromise sensitive data.

item.title: Windows SMB Client Zero-Day Vulnerability Exploited via Reflective Kerberos Relay Attack
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-33073; Summary: The "Reflective Kerberos Relay Attack" allows low-privileged Active Directory users to escalate privileges to NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM on domain-joined Windows systems that do not enforce SMB signing. The attack exploits advanced techniques such as authentication coercion, SPN confusion, and Kerberos ticket relay, resulting in SYSTEM-level access.

item.title: 0-Click Vulnerability in Microsoft 365 Copilot Exposes Sensitive Data via Teams
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft 365 Copilot; CVE(s): CVE-2025-32711; Summary: A zero-click vulnerability, dubbed "EchoLeak", was discovered in Microsoft 365 Copilot's Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system, allowing attackers to automatically exfiltrate sensitive information without user interaction. The vulnerability exploits an "LLM Scope Violation" and affects the processing of organizational data, including emails, documents, and conversations.

item.title: ConnectWise to Rotate ScreenConnect Code Signing Certificates Due to Security Risks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ConnectWise; CVE(s): None; Summary: The vulnerability stems from ScreenConnect storing configuration data in an unsigned area of the installer, which could create an insecure design pattern. The company is releasing an update to improve configuration data management and rotating digital code signing certificates due to security concerns.

item.title: Operation Secure: INTERPOL’s Global Infostealer Crackdown Takes Down 20,000 Malicious IPs and Domains
item.description: INTERPOL's Operation Secure resulted in the dismantling of 20,000 malicious IPs and domains, seizure of 41 servers, and arrest of 32 suspects, with a focus on taking down cybercriminal networks trafficking in stolen information. The operation involved intelligence gathering, analysis, and precise actions by law enforcement agencies across Asia and the South Pacific.

item.title: Nytheon AI Tool Gaining Traction on Hacking Forums for Malicious Activities
item.description: Nytheon AI is a comprehensive suite of open-source large language models (LLMs) that offers a single interface for uncensored model inference. The platform's multimodal ingestion pipeline and API-driven automation create a dynamic threat landscape, posing substantial risks to organizations and individuals.

item.title: CISA Issues Comprehensive Guide to Safeguard Network Edge Devices
item.description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has released comprehensive guidance to help organizations protect their network edge devices and appliances from foreign adversaries. The guidance addresses the growing threat landscape targeting firewalls, routers, VPN gateways, IoT devices, internet-facing servers, and OT systems.

item.title: Over 80,000 Microsoft Entra ID Accounts Targeted Using Open-Source TeamFiltration Tool
item.description: Vulnerable Product: TeamFiltration; CVE(s): None; Summary: The open-source penetration testing framework TeamFiltration is being misused by threat actors in a large-scale account takeover campaign called UNK_SneakyStrike. The tool, designed to enumerate and breach Microsoft Entra ID accounts, has been used to target over 80,000 user accounts across hundreds of organizations' cloud tenants.

item.title: ChatGPT o3 API 80% price drop has no impact on performance
item.description: The article discusses OpenAI's price reduction of its ChatGPT o3 API model, which has no visible impact on performance. Additionally, it mentions the introduction of a new o3-pro model for $200 Pro subscribers and plans to combine multiple models into GPT-5.
